dict.string: API (2!)
!ApiNgrok

Dear _____ ,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support.


Please note that Ngrok is not publicly accessible through the internet (unless your local host/terminal is actively running) Twilio will not be able to successfully reach Ngrok when your terminal is off. I will not recommend using Ngrok to host your webhooks. I will recommend hosting your URLs on a publicly accessible hosting service such as your own web server or web hosting services such as Heroku.


Please let me know if you have further questions.


Thanks,
API - Ngrok Not Publicly Accessible Over the Internet

Dear _____ ,
Thank you for contacting Twilio Support.
Please note that Ngrok is not publicly accessible through the internet (unless your local host/terminal is actively running) Twilio will not be able to successfully reach Ngrok when your terminal is off. I will not recommend using Ngrok to host your webhooks. I will recommend hosting your URLs on a publicly accessible hosting service such as your own web server or web hosting services such as Heroku.
Please let me know if you have further questions.
Thanks,
!ApiExportingRecords

Dear ______,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I am very sorry to hear you are unable to export the full records for your SMS logs:


May I ask are there more than 1,000 records that needs to be exported? Please note that your Twilio Console is not meant for high volume exporting. The Twilio Console can export logs up to ~1,000 records, for more than 1,000 records please utilize our Twilio Helper Library/API. Please feel free to use the DateSent filter to export records from specific date or timeframe. Below I have attached our FAQ that explains in detail on how to do this. Please take a look at these options and kindly try it out:


https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223183588-Exporting-SMS-and-Call-Logs#getting-lots-of-data


Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.


Warmest Regards,
API - Recommend to use Helper Library when Exporting Logs over 1,000 Records

Dear ______,
Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I am very sorry to hear you are unable to export the full records for your SMS logs:
May I ask are there more than 1,000 records that needs to be exported? Please note that your Twilio Console is not meant for high volume exporting. The Twilio Console can export logs up to ~1,000 records, for more than 1,000 records please utilize our Twilio Helper Library/API. Please feel free to use the DateSent filter to export records from specific date or timeframe. Below I have attached our FAQ that explains in detail on how to do this. Please take a look at these options and kindly try it out:
https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223183588-Exporting-SMS-and-Call-Logs#getting-lots-of-data
Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.
Warmest Regards,
!ApiBulkSMS

GROUP VS BULK MESSAGES:


Dear _____,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. Great question!


May you please clarify would you like to send group messages (threading among all participants -- Twilo does not support) or bulk messages (no threading among participants -- Twilio supports) to multiple phone numbers? The reason I ask is because Twilio supports bulk messaging which multiple recipients receive the same message, but there is no threading involved.


To send messages in bulk, please do this programmatically using Twilio's Messaging API. Twilio does not support bulk messaging directly within your Twilio Console. I have attached a PHP example below that explains how to iterate through a list of numbers to send messages in bulk (please focus on Step 4):


https://www.twilio.com/docs/quickstart/php/sms/sending-via-rest#code-send-sms-using-twilio


https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223181548-Can-I-set-up-one-API-call-to-send-messages-to-a-list-of-people-


Alternatively, you can look into 3rd party services that will allow sending messages in bulk without needing to program it out:


http://www.sendhub.com/


https://zapier.com/zapbook/twilio/


Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.


Warmest Regards,

————

REQUEST FOR API EXPLORER SMS IN BULK (NOT SUPPORTED):


Dear _____,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. Great question!


Twilio currently does not provide a user interface to send messages in bulk. We do provide a user interface called API Explorer to send messages, however API Explorer only works in sending indvidual messages:


https://www.twilio.com/console/dev-tools/api-explorer/sms/sms-mms-create


To send messages in bulk, please do this programmatically using Twilio's Messaging API. I have attached a PHP example below that explains how to iterate through a list of numbers to send messages in bulk (please focus on Step 4):


https://www.twilio.com/docs/quickstart/php/sms/sending-via-rest#code-send-sms-using-twilio


https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223181548-Can-I-set-up-one-API-call-to-send-messages-to-a-list-of-people-


Alternatively, you can look into 3rd party services that will allow sending messages in bulk without needing to program it out:


http://www.sendhub.com/


https://zapier.com/zapbook/twilio/


Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.


Warmest Regards,
API - Send SMS - Sending Messages in Bulk

GROUP VS BULK MESSAGES:
Dear _____,
Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. Great question!
May you please clarify would you like to send group messages (threading among all participants -- Twilo does not support) or bulk messages (no threading among participants -- Twilio supports) to multiple phone numbers? The reason I ask is because Twilio supports bulk messaging which multiple recipients receive the same message, but there is no threading involved.
To send messages in bulk, please do this programmatically using Twilio's Messaging API. Twilio does not support bulk messaging directly within your Twilio Console. I have attached a PHP example below that explains how to iterate through a list of numbers to send messages in bulk (please focus on Step 4):
https://www.twilio.com/docs/quickstart/php/sms/sending-via-rest#code-send-sms-using-twilio
https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223181548-Can-I-set-up-one-API-call-to-send-messages-to-a-list-of-people-
Alternatively, you can look into 3rd party services that will allow sending messages in bulk without needing to program it out:
http://www.sendhub.com/
https://zapier.com/zapbook/twilio/
Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.
Warmest Regards,
————

!Api15Seconds

Dear _____ ,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I am very sorry to hear regarding the issue you are experiencing with timeout.


Twilio's system is hard coded where our timeout is set to 15 seconds across our systems. Unfortunately, there is not a way for us to increase the timeout to ____. I will recommend to work with your IT/Networking Team to see if there is any way to increase response performance on your server/ Request URL.


I sincerely apologize for the inconvenience. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.


Warmest Regards,
API - 15 Seconds Response Cannot be Modified

Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I am very sorry to hear regarding the issue you are experiencing with timeout.

I sincerely apologize for the inconvenience. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.
Warmest Regards,

!ApiUrlDifference

Dear _____,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support.


To clarify the behavior of StatusCallback URLs, Twilio will post the status of the messages as well as the standard request parameters. For more information, please review the information in the StatusCallback Parameter in our below documentation:


https://www.twilio.com/docs/sms/twiml#request-parameters


Please note that for the additional information that Twilio provides, Twilio will post this additional information only to the Message Request URL and not the StatusCallback URL.


Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.


Warmest Regards,
API - Information in StatusCallback URL vs in Message Request URL

Dear _____,
Thank you for contacting Twilio Support.
To clarify the behavior of StatusCallback URLs, Twilio will post the status of the messages as well as the standard request parameters. For more information, please review the information in the StatusCallback Parameter in our below documentation:
https://www.twilio.com/docs/sms/twiml#request-parameters
Please note that for the additional information that Twilio provides, Twilio will post this additional information only to the Message Request URL and not the StatusCallback URL.
Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.
Warmest Regards,
!ApiModifySender

OPTION 1:


Dear ______,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I am sorry to hear you received an error while attempting to send messages.


Twilio only supports the "from" number using any of Twilio's SMS-enabled Twilio phone number or using Alphanumeric SenderID. Twilio does not support "from" phone numbers issued from other mobile institutions such as the number you are trying to use. We will not be able to support the number you are attempting to use. This is due to security purposes in how SMS messages are regulated and to avoid carrier filtering.


More information can be found here:


https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223133967-Changing-the-sender-ID-for-sending-SMS-messages

Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.


Warmest Regards,


——


OPTION 2:


Dear _____,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. Great question!


Due to SMS regulations, we do not support the "From" number as your personal cell number. You can specify the From parameter to be any SMS-enabled Twilio number (in your account) or alphanumeric sender ID. When sending a SMS message from Twilio, you cannot set the ‘From’ phone number as a phone number that you do not own in your Twilio Account.


If you would like to learn more about Alphanumeric Sender ID please see the link below:


https://www.twilio.com/help/faq/sms/what-is-alphanumeric-sender-id-and-how-do-i-get-started


I apologize for the inconvenience. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.


Warmest Regards,
API - Send SMS - Modifying Sender ID

OPTION 1:

Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I am sorry to hear you received an error while attempting to send messages.
Twilio only supports the "from" number using any of Twilio's SMS-enabled Twilio phone number or using Alphanumeric SenderID. Twilio does not support "from" phone numbers issued from other mobile institutions such as the number you are trying to use. We will not be able to support the number you are attempting to use. This is due to security purposes in how SMS messages are regulated and to avoid carrier filtering.
More information can be found here:

Warmest Regards,

Warmest Regards,
!ApiTollfreeMMS

OPTION 1:



Hello _____, 


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support.


MMS over toll-free number has not been adopted by the industry and is not supported by most providers. Please note that incoming MMS messages will not be received by your Twilio toll-free numbers at all. It will not come through to your Twilio toll-free numbers and will not be converted as a SMS. 


I sincerely apologize for the inconvenience. 


Thanks,

——---


OPTION 2:



Dear ____,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. Great question!


Please note that MMS over toll-free number has not been adopted by the industry and is not supported by most providers. This is not a Twilio only limitation but an industry limitation. Unfortunately, as this is not a Twilio limitation, we do not currently have an ETA of when and whether toll-free numbers will support MMS messaging. 


I hope this information is helpful. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.


Warmest Regards,

-----


OPTION 3:


Dear ____,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support.


It looks like you are trying to send MMS messages with a toll-free number. Please keep in mind that toll-free numbers do not support MMS messaging.


Currently, Twilio offers MMS-enabled long code phone numbers in the US and Canada. If you would like to purchase a MMS-enabled long code number please log into your Twilio account to buy a number. In the Buy a Number page below, please click onto "Advanced Search" that is next to the "Search" button. In the Advanced Search page, in the "Capabilities" field, choose "MMS" and other features that best fit your needs.


https://www.twilio.com/console/phone-numbers/search


Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.


Warmest Regards,
API - Send MMS- Toll-Free Number Don’t Support MMS

OPTION 1:
Hello _____,
Thank you for contacting Twilio Support.
MMS over toll-free number has not been adopted by the industry and is not supported by most providers. Please note that incoming MMS messages will not be received by your Twilio toll-free numbers at all. It will not come through to your Twilio toll-free numbers and will not be converted as a SMS.
I sincerely apologize for the inconvenience.
Thanks,
——---

Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. Great question!
Please note that MMS over toll-free number has not been adopted by the industry and is not supported by most providers. This is not a Twilio only limitation but an industry limitation. Unfortunately, as this is not a Twilio limitation, we do not currently have an ETA of when and whether toll-free numbers will support MMS messaging.
I hope this information is helpful. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.
Warmest Regards,

OPTION 3:
Dear ____,
Thank you for contacting Twilio Support.
It looks like you are trying to send MMS messages with a toll-free number. Please keep in mind that toll-free numbers do not support MMS messaging.
Currently, Twilio offers MMS-enabled long code phone numbers in the US and Canada. If you would like to purchase a MMS-enabled long code number please log into your Twilio account to buy a number. In the Buy a Number page below, please click onto "Advanced Search" that is next to the "Search" button. In the Advanced Search page, in the "Capabilities" field, choose "MMS" and other features that best fit your needs.
https://www.twilio.com/console/phone-numbers/search
Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.
Warmest Regards,
9C3C5EFB-CBCE-41E7-B70A-9F2AB1F171F7
!ApiTwimlMsg

Dear _____,



The XML document (or TwiML document) I am referring to is the document that Twilio uses to obtain instructions from in order to know what to do with your SMS messages. For example, when your end users text into your Twilio number, Twilio will make a request to your webhook/request URL to retrieve instructions from this XML document in order to know how to "respond" to your end users' messages. In this XML document there is TwiML - TwiML is a Twilio language that Twilio uses in order to know what to do with your end users' incoming messages.


A XML document that Twilio can uses has the below TwiML, it always starts off with the XML header: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> :


<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

<Response>

<Message>Thank you for the message!</Message>

<Redirect>https://demo.twilio.com/sms/welcome</Redirect>

</Response>


https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/twiml/sms/your_response#twiml-interpreter


https://www.twilio.com/docs/sms/twiml#how-twilios-twiml-interpreter-works


When your end users sends a message to your Twilio number, Twilio will respond with "Thank you for the message!" using the above TwiML instructions.


I hope this gives you a better understanding of how TwiML works. Please let me know if you have further questions.


Thanks,
API - How to Use Message TwiML?

Dear _____,
The XML document (or TwiML document) I am referring to is the document that Twilio uses to obtain instructions from in order to know what to do with your SMS messages. For example, when your end users text into your Twilio number, Twilio will make a request to your webhook/request URL to retrieve instructions from this XML document in order to know how to "respond" to your end users' messages. In this XML document there is TwiML - TwiML is a Twilio language that Twilio uses in order to know what to do with your end users' incoming messages.
A XML document that Twilio can uses has the below TwiML, it always starts off with the XML header: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> :
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <Response> <Message>Thank you for the message!</Message> <Redirect>https://demo.twilio.com/sms/welcome</Redirect> </Response>
https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/twiml/sms/your_response#twiml-interpreter
https://www.twilio.com/docs/sms/twiml#how-twilios-twiml-interpreter-works
When your end users sends a message to your Twilio number, Twilio will respond with "Thank you for the message!" using the above TwiML instructions.
I hope this gives you a better understanding of how TwiML works. Please let me know if you have further questions.
Thanks,
D4D8BB00-532C-11E8-9A21-9F9EC7D8CDAC
!ApiAuth

Dear ____,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support.


After further investigation, it appears that you are using HTTP Authentication. How HTTP Authentication works is that if you specify a password-protected URL, Twilio will first send a request with no Authorization header. After your server responds with a 401 Unauthorized response, Twilio will make the same request with an Authorization header. For more information about how we authenticate URLS, please below:


The above is from https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/security#http-authentication


Please let me know if you have further questions.


Thanks,
API - HTTP Basic and Digest Authentication (returns 401 unauthorized response)

Dear ____,
Thank you for contacting Twilio Support.
After further investigation, it appears that you are using HTTP Authentication. How HTTP Authentication works is that if you specify a password-protected URL, Twilio will first send a request with no Authorization header. After your server responds with a 401 Unauthorized response, Twilio will make the same request with an Authorization header. For more information about how we authenticate URLS, please below:
The above is from https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/security#http-authentication
Please let me know if you have further questions.
Thanks,
!ApiStopOff

Dear _____,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. Great question!


Please note that Twilio only supports managing the opt-in/out process for long codes. We do not manage the opt-in/out process for short codes.


If you'd prefer to handle the opt-in/out process for long codes, I can disable Twilio's opt-in/out system for your account. I can remove this filtering for your long codes on your account, and then you would control the entire "stop/help" process allowing you to modify the message as you see fit. The key thing though is that you will need to maintain the whole process of those who opted "in and out". 


In accordance with industry standards, by default Twilio will handle a few types of messages so that accounts don't need to build this filtering functionality. The following messages will be automatically handled:


https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223134027-Twilio-support-for-STOP-BLOCK-and-CANCEL-SMS-STOP-filtering- 


I can turn off this setting for your account if you can commit to building these filtering mechanisms in yourself. Please let me know if you'll be able to build this functionality into your app, and I'll go ahead and disable the setting on our side. 


I look forward to hearing back from you. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help. 


Warmest Regards,
API - STOP Filtering - Turn off STOP/HELP Filtering on Customer Account

Dear _____,
Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. Great question!
Please note that Twilio only supports managing the opt-in/out process for long codes. We do not manage the opt-in/out process for short codes.
If you'd prefer to handle the opt-in/out process for long codes, I can disable Twilio's opt-in/out system for your account. I can remove this filtering for your long codes on your account, and then you would control the entire "stop/help" process allowing you to modify the message as you see fit. The key thing though is that you will need to maintain the whole process of those who opted "in and out".
In accordance with industry standards, by default Twilio will handle a few types of messages so that accounts don't need to build this filtering functionality. The following messages will be automatically handled:
https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223134027-Twilio-support-for-STOP-BLOCK-and-CANCEL-SMS-STOP-filtering-
I can turn off this setting for your account if you can commit to building these filtering mechanisms in yourself. Please let me know if you'll be able to build this functionality into your app, and I'll go ahead and disable the setting on our side.
I look forward to hearing back from you. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.
Warmest Regards,
!ApiStopCancel

Dear _____, 


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I am very sorry to hear that the end user's "cancel" was treated as a "STOP". 


Unfortunately, only using "cancel" as a response is an industry standard SMS keyword which will automatically opt-out end users from receiving further messages. If you would like to customize Opt-in/Out keywords, I can turn off Twilio's automatic handling system for your account. However, this will require you to build your own handling system. Also, please note these are industry standard keywords and I will recommend keeping these keywords for opt-in/out purposes if possible. 


Alternatively, I will recommend letting end users know in your SMS messages to use another word aside from "cancel" to confirm cancellation. 


Below I have listed the keywords that are supported for Twilio's automatic handling system:


https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223134027-Twilio-support-for-STOP-BLOCK-and-CANCEL-SMS-STOP-filtering- 


I apologize for the inconvenience. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help. 


Warmest Regards,
API - STOP Filtering - Using Cancel as one of the "Keywords"

Dear _____,
Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I am very sorry to hear that the end user's "cancel" was treated as a "STOP".
Unfortunately, only using "cancel" as a response is an industry standard SMS keyword which will automatically opt-out end users from receiving further messages. If you would like to customize Opt-in/Out keywords, I can turn off Twilio's automatic handling system for your account. However, this will require you to build your own handling system. Also, please note these are industry standard keywords and I will recommend keeping these keywords for opt-in/out purposes if possible.
Alternatively, I will recommend letting end users know in your SMS messages to use another word aside from "cancel" to confirm cancellation.
Below I have listed the keywords that are supported for Twilio's automatic handling system:
https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223134027-Twilio-support-for-STOP-BLOCK-and-CANCEL-SMS-STOP-filtering-
I apologize for the inconvenience. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.
Warmest Regards,
!ApiStopCustomize

Dear _______, 


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. Great question!


There isn't a way to customize your START/STOP messages as these message are hard coded into our automatic handling system. If you would like us to have customized START/STOP messages, I can turn off our automatic handling system for your account. However, this will require you to build your own handling system.


Please make sure you fulfill the below criteria that is in accordance with industry standards, please see URL:


https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223134027-Twilio-support-for-STOP-BLOCK-and-CANCEL-SMS-STOP-filtering-


STOP, UNSUBSCRIBE, CANCEL, AND QUIT will stop customers from receiving your messages. Your account will get the message in your logs to track the unsubscribe request. 


START, YES will opt customers back in to your messages. Your account will get the message in your logs to track the subscription request.


HELP and INFO will display basic information about your account. Your account won't get the message in your logs to avoid duplicate help responses from being sent to your customers.


I can turn off this setting for your account if you can commit to building these filtering mechanisms in yourself. Please let me know if you'll be able to build this functionality into your app, and I'll go ahead and disable the setting on our side. 


I look forward to hearing back from you. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help. 


Warmest Regards,
API - STOP Filtering - Cannot Customize START/STOP Messages

Dear _______,
Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. Great question!
There isn't a way to customize your START/STOP messages as these message are hard coded into our automatic handling system. If you would like us to have customized START/STOP messages, I can turn off our automatic handling system for your account. However, this will require you to build your own handling system.
Please make sure you fulfill the below criteria that is in accordance with industry standards, please see URL:
https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223134027-Twilio-support-for-STOP-BLOCK-and-CANCEL-SMS-STOP-filtering-
STOP, UNSUBSCRIBE, CANCEL, AND QUIT will stop customers from receiving your messages. Your account will get the message in your logs to track the unsubscribe request.
START, YES will opt customers back in to your messages. Your account will get the message in your logs to track the subscription request.
HELP and INFO will display basic information about your account. Your account won't get the message in your logs to avoid duplicate help responses from being sent to your customers.
I can turn off this setting for your account if you can commit to building these filtering mechanisms in yourself. Please let me know if you'll be able to build this functionality into your app, and I'll go ahead and disable the setting on our side.
I look forward to hearing back from you. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.
Warmest Regards,
2E50DF0E-59EB-419B-BBA3-57B0FD2D4FE0
!ApiStopAccountLevel

OPTION 1


Dear _____, 


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. Great question!


By default, Twilio has an Opt-in/Opt-out system that handles the mandatory keywords that you mentioned. Please note that this system is enabled on an account level and not by individual numbers. Unfortunately, if I disabled the Opt-in/Opt-out system on your account (where you will need to handle this process on your end), all of your Twilio numbers will no longer have the automatic Opt-in/Opt-out service applied to your numbers. 


Please let me know if you will like to continue to use Twilio automatic Opt-in/Opt-out system or handle this process on your end. Feel free to let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help. 


Warmest Regards,


--------


OPTION 2:


Please note that when I enabled Twilio's opt-in/out system, it will occur at an account level and not by individual numbers. All the numbers in your "Virtuwell Account" will have Twilio's opt-in/out system enabled. Would you like me to proceed in enabling for your "Virtuwell Account"?


I look forward to hearing back from you.


Thanks,


Josephine
API - STOP Filtering - STOP Filtering Happens on an Account Level

OPTION 1
Dear _____,
Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. Great question!
By default, Twilio has an Opt-in/Opt-out system that handles the mandatory keywords that you mentioned. Please note that this system is enabled on an account level and not by individual numbers. Unfortunately, if I disabled the Opt-in/Opt-out system on your account (where you will need to handle this process on your end), all of your Twilio numbers will no longer have the automatic Opt-in/Opt-out service applied to your numbers.
Please let me know if you will like to continue to use Twilio automatic Opt-in/Opt-out system or handle this process on your end. Feel free to let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.
Warmest Regards,
--------
OPTION 2:
Please note that when I enabled Twilio's opt-in/out system, it will occur at an account level and not by individual numbers. All the numbers in your "Virtuwell Account" will have Twilio's opt-in/out system enabled. Would you like me to proceed in enabling for your "Virtuwell Account"?
I look forward to hearing back from you.
Thanks,
Josephine
!ApiStopKeywords

Hello _____,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. Great question!


Below are our full list of supported keywords and the responses to these keywords:


STOP, STOPALL, UNSUBSCRIBE, CANCEL, END, and QUIT  - "You have successfully been unsubscribed. You will not receive any more messages from this number. Reply START to resubscribe"


START, YES and UNSTOP - "You have successfully been resubscribed to messages from this number. Reply HELP for help. Reply STOP to unsubscribe. Msg&Data Rates May Apply." 


HELP and INFO - "Reply STOP to unsubscribe. Msg&Data Rates May Apply."


Please let me know if you have further questions.


Thanks,

START, YES and UNSTOP - "You have successfully been resubscribed to messages from this number. Reply HELP for help. Reply STOP to unsubscribe. Msg&Data Rates May Apply."
HELP and INFO - "Reply STOP to unsubscribe. Msg&Data Rates May Apply."

!ApiStopRules

Dear ______,  


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. Great question!


It is up to you whether you will like to include opt-in/out information in your SMS messages. This will depend on whether your end users were notified of opt-in/out information through other forms of communication. According to SMS industry standards, you must inform end users on how to opt-in/out of receiving messages. A lot of our customers state everything clearly on their website ways to opt-in/out of opt-in/out of receiving messages. Some also inform end users through e-mail. If your end users are already notified of opt-in/out information, you will not need to state it again in your SMS messages. I will recommend taking a look at our documentation below that explains all the keywords that we accept to opt-in/out and to conduct other functionalities:


https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223134027-Twilio-support-for-STOP-BLOCK-and-CANCEL-SMS-STOP-filtering- 

 

Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help. 


Warmest Regards,

!ApiStopCriteria

Dear _____, 


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support.  Great question!


According to SMS industry standards, customers have the right to opt in and out of receiving messages at anytime (i.e. customers can opt-in with START and opt-out with STOP). As this is the customer's right, Twilio does not support the ability for you to opt users in and out on your end. ***However, if your customer is not responding to your e-mails, I can help you internally block your Twilio numbers from reaching your customer. 


Please provide your customer's number and I can proceed in stopping your Twilio numbers from reaching this customer. 


I look forward to hearing back from you. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help. 


Warmest Regards,

Please provide your customer's number and I can proceed in stopping your Twilio numbers from reaching this customer.
I look forward to hearing back from you. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.

!ApiStopTrackStop

Dear ______, 


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. Great question!


Below are a few ways you can track whether your end users unsubscribe/ text in STOP to receiving your messages. If you will like to do this programmatically, you will need to set up a logic in your application to pull information from the body property to detect keywords such as STOP, CANCEL, etc. To see a full list of the keywords that end users can use to unsubscribe, please see below:


https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223134027-Twilio-support-for-STOP-BLOCK-and-CANCEL-SMS-STOP-filtering- 


(1) You can use the Message List Resource to pull a list of all your messages and then track the keywords in the body of the messages. Please note for the Message List Resource we have the DateSent parameter which will allow you to filter messages based on specific dates, please note that this parameter does not allow you to choose time:


https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/rest/message#list 


(2) We also pass body information to your Message Request URL when your Twilio number receives a message. You can track body information this way as well:


https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/twiml/sms/twilio_request 


(3) You can also do this manually by exporting a CSV of all your messages and then filter your  CSV for the specific keywords. Please note that using the SMS logs in Console allows you to filter by both date and time:


Please go to your SMS logs below:


https://www.twilio.com/console/sms/logs 


(4) Track by Error Code 21610 - "Message cannot be sent to the 'To' number because the customer has replied with STOP"


https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/errors/21610 


***The easiest way to pull this information is to track Error Code 21610 in your Twilio Debugger and press into the individual events to see the recipient number that have opted out:


https://www.twilio.com/console/runtime/debugger?groupBy=code&query=21610&quickDate=720 


Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help. 


Warmest Regards,
API - STOP Filtering - How to Track STOP Responses from End Users

Dear ______,
Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. Great question!
Below are a few ways you can track whether your end users unsubscribe/ text in STOP to receiving your messages. If you will like to do this programmatically, you will need to set up a logic in your application to pull information from the body property to detect keywords such as STOP, CANCEL, etc. To see a full list of the keywords that end users can use to unsubscribe, please see below:
https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223134027-Twilio-support-for-STOP-BLOCK-and-CANCEL-SMS-STOP-filtering-
(1) You can use the Message List Resource to pull a list of all your messages and then track the keywords in the body of the messages. Please note for the Message List Resource we have the DateSent parameter which will allow you to filter messages based on specific dates, please note that this parameter does not allow you to choose time:
https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/rest/message#list
(2) We also pass body information to your Message Request URL when your Twilio number receives a message. You can track body information this way as well:
https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/twiml/sms/twilio_request
(3) You can also do this manually by exporting a CSV of all your messages and then filter your CSV for the specific keywords. Please note that using the SMS logs in Console allows you to filter by both date and time:
Please go to your SMS logs below:
https://www.twilio.com/console/sms/logs
(4) Track by Error Code 21610 - "Message cannot be sent to the 'To' number because the customer has replied with STOP"
https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/errors/21610
***The easiest way to pull this information is to track Error Code 21610 in your Twilio Debugger and press into the individual events to see the recipient number that have opted out:
https://www.twilio.com/console/runtime/debugger?groupBy=code&query=21610&quickDate=720
Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.

!ApiSmsConversations

Dear _____,  


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. Great question! Twilio offers a simple way to keep track of SMS conversations between two phone numbers by using HTTP cookies. For Twilio SMS, cookies are scoped to the "conversation" between two parties -- you can have a unique cookie for each To/From phone number pair. Please note that a unique cookie is tracked for each To/From phone number pair. If user A and B uses a different To/From phone number pair, a new cookie will be initiated. 


Please take a look at our documentations below of how to get started and for examples:


https://www.twilio.com/docs/quickstart/ruby/sms/tracking-conversations


https://www.twilio.com/blog/2014/07/the-definitive-guide-to-sms-conversation-tracking.html


I hope this information is helpful. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help. 


Warmest Regards,
API - SMS Conversations - How to Track SMS Conversations General Template

Dear _____,
Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. Great question! Twilio offers a simple way to keep track of SMS conversations between two phone numbers by using HTTP cookies. For Twilio SMS, cookies are scoped to the "conversation" between two parties -- you can have a unique cookie for each To/From phone number pair. Please note that a unique cookie is tracked for each To/From phone number pair. If user A and B uses a different To/From phone number pair, a new cookie will be initiated.
Please take a look at our documentations below of how to get started and for examples:
https://www.twilio.com/docs/quickstart/ruby/sms/tracking-conversations
https://www.twilio.com/blog/2014/07/the-definitive-guide-to-sms-conversation-tracking.html

Warmest Regards,
!ApiCookiesTopic

Hello ____,


Great question! There isn't a direct way you can do this as Twilio only tracks conversations between two numbers through cookies. We are unable to track which responses are for which topic of conversation. We will just track everything as one conversation as how it is like when sending messages from a handset-to-handset. 


What you can do to differentiate conversations is to maintain the session store yourself, e.g. with a database table of "From", "To", and timestamp. Twilio cookies are keyed off of "From" and "To", so you can implement the same kind of conversation tracking yourself by storing data this way. If you would like to differentiate conversations by To/From and specific topics, you may have to track other unique metadata to differentiate the conversations. For example, you can input a unique identifier in the message or some sort of unique keyword that can help differentiate the conversations.


Please let me know if you have further questions.


Thanks,
API - SMS Conversations - Cookies Cannot Track Topic of Convos

Hello ____,
Great question! There isn't a direct way you can do this as Twilio only tracks conversations between two numbers through cookies. We are unable to track which responses are for which topic of conversation. We will just track everything as one conversation as how it is like when sending messages from a handset-to-handset.
What you can do to differentiate conversations is to maintain the session store yourself, e.g. with a database table of "From", "To", and timestamp. Twilio cookies are keyed off of "From" and "To", so you can implement the same kind of conversation tracking yourself by storing data this way. If you would like to differentiate conversations by To/From and specific topics, you may have to track other unique metadata to differentiate the conversations. For example, you can input a unique identifier in the message or some sort of unique keyword that can help differentiate the conversations.
Please let me know if you have further questions.
Thanks,
!ApiCookiesLimitation

Hello _____, 


Great questions! Below are answers to your questions:


(1) There isn't a way to increase cookie life. The maximum life is 4 hours. 


(2) Unfortunately, each "To"/"From" number pair will use "one cookie" to track conversations within the 4 hour period. After the 4 hour period, a new cookie will be initiated. If having separate events for each "To"/"From" number pair is important for your use case, you may want to consider other methods on top of using cookies. For example, choose a pool of phone numbers to send from so that this correlation by phone numbers can be unique, use specific keywords in the body of your messages, and track by timestamps. 


There is also an intensive guide that talks about tracking SMS conversations that you may also find helpful:


https://www.twilio.com/blog/2014/07/the-definitive-guide-to-sms-conversation-tracking.html


I apologize for the inconvenience. Please let me know if you have further questions.


Thanks,
API - SMS Conversations - Cookies Limitation

Hello _____,
Great questions! Below are answers to your questions:
(1) There isn't a way to increase cookie life. The maximum life is 4 hours.
(2) Unfortunately, each "To"/"From" number pair will use "one cookie" to track conversations within the 4 hour period. After the 4 hour period, a new cookie will be initiated. If having separate events for each "To"/"From" number pair is important for your use case, you may want to consider other methods on top of using cookies. For example, choose a pool of phone numbers to send from so that this correlation by phone numbers can be unique, use specific keywords in the body of your messages, and track by timestamps.
There is also an intensive guide that talks about tracking SMS conversations that you may also find helpful:
https://www.twilio.com/blog/2014/07/the-definitive-guide-to-sms-conversation-tracking.html
I apologize for the inconvenience. Please let me know if you have further questions.
Thanks,

!ApiPagesize

OPTION 1:


Dear _____,  


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I hope today finds you well. Great question!


I will recommend using the pagesize property below which will allow you to adjust how many results are returned. The default is 50, and the maximum result is 1000.


https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/rest/response#response-formats-list-filters


When fetching multiple pages of API results, please use the provided nextpageuri parameter to retrieve the next page of results. Please see below for more information:


Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help. 


Warmest Regards,


------


OPTION 2:


Dear _______,  


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. Great question!


May I ask when you run your code does it return all 50 recordings at once? As in all results return in one page? The reason I ask is because for pagesize our default is to return 50 items on each page. If your maximum count is set to 50 records and our pagesize also returns 50 items per page, this may be the reason why response time is slower than expected.


I will recommend using the pagesize property to decrease page size to 10 pages so that returned results will be 10 instead of 50 items per page. We should see faster response time after decreasing pagesize. 


For more information about pagesize, please see below:


https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/rest/response#response-formats-list-paging-information


Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help. 


Warmest Regards,

!ApiTwimlbin

Hello _____,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. Great question!


TwiMLBin is hosting service managed by Twilio where you can configure and host your Message Request URL directly with Twilio. Please note that TwiMLBin URLs may not be hosted indefinitely, but it can be helpful as a temporary situation while you make changes to your Message Request URL.


How to Set-Up TwiMLBin: https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223136047


Use TwiMLBin Dynamically: https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/230878368-How-to-use-templates-with-TwiML-Bins


Please let me know if you have further questions.


Thanks,

!Api100

Dear _____,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I am very sorry to hear you are getting a 'Too Many Requests' error.


If you are using Twilio long codes, we have a limit of no more than 100 concurrent API request at a time. If you will like to bypass this limit of 100 concurrent API request, please considering using a short code and to use our new service that is in Beta called Passthrough API which will allow you to send a concurrent API request of 10K messages.


For more information regarding short codes:


https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223182068-What-is-a-short-code-


For more information regarding our Passthrough API:


https://www.twilio.com/blog/2017/08/bulk-sms-with-one-api-request.html


Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.


Warmest Regards,


Josephine T.

Technical Support Engineer

Twilio, Inc

!ApiQueuingSystem

Is there a way for our API to signal that it is unable to process a status update or inbound message at the current time, and to have your service resend that request automatically at a later time? e.g., by sending a "Retry-After" HTTP header in our response


OPTION 1:


Additionally, you may want to consider looking into services that supports a high availability queuing system. Amazon Simple Queue Service provides this. If you notice your application consistently sends a huge batch to Twilio, you can use this queuing service to slowdown the requests you make to Twilio https://aws.amazon.com/sqs/


——


OPTION 2:


No, what you are looking for is not directly supported by Twilio. However, you may want to consider looking into other services that supports a high availability queuing system. Amazon Simple Queue Service provides this. Instead of having your callback url go directly to your own system, you will route it to a queueing system that then forwards to your application. https://aws.amazon.com/sqs/
API - Slowing Down API Requests - High Availability Queuing System (Amazon Simple Queue Service)

Is there a way for our API to signal that it is unable to process a status update or inbound message at the current time, and to have your service resend that request automatically at a later time? e.g., by sending a "Retry-After" HTTP header in our response
OPTION 1:
Additionally, you may want to consider looking into services that supports a high availability queuing system. Amazon Simple Queue Service provides this. If you notice your application consistently sends a huge batch to Twilio, you can use this queuing service to slowdown the requests you make to Twilio https://aws.amazon.com/sqs/
——
OPTION 2:
No, what you are looking for is not directly supported by Twilio. However, you may want to consider looking into other services that supports a high availability queuing system. Amazon Simple Queue Service provides this. Instead of having your callback url go directly to your own system, you will route it to a queueing system that then forwards to your application. https://aws.amazon.com/sqs/
!ApiNoBrowser

Dear ____,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support.


Are you attempting to send a message all within one line similar to accessing it directly through the browser? If so, please note, this is not supported. 


Please note that the request parameters will need to be in the HTTP Request Body and not in a query string. Credentials will also need to be in an Authorization Header. 


Below are the few methods in which you can send messages using Twilio, programmatically or through Twilio's User Interface--API Explorer:


https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/messaging/send-messages 


https://www.twilio.com/console/dev-tools/api-explorer/sms/sms-mms-create


Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.


Warmest Regards,

!ApiMMSMedia

OPTION 1:


Dear ________,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I am very sorry to hear you are unable to retrieve the media for your MMS messages.


To retrieve the individual image file, please use the following resource below. Please note that you do not need to append an extension at the end of this resource. Please do not append the .jpg in your Resource URL. Without an extension, the image is returned using the mime-type (jpeg, gif, png)- https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/rest/accepted-mime-types provided when the media was generated.


/2010-04-01/Accounts/AC.../Message/MM.../Media/____


https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223181368-How-Do-I-Retrieve-Image-Files-from-MMS-Messages-


Please kindly retest. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.


Warmest Regards,


———


OPTION 2:


Dear ____,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. Great question! This is a two step process. You will need to first use the Media List Resource to retrieve a list of media SIDs associated with your message.


https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/rest/media#list


Then, you can use the Media Instance Resource to retrieve the individual image file associated with a message by using the individual media SIDs.


https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/rest/media#instance


Please take a look at the "Default: Content-Type Section". Please end the resource with just the Media SID without .xml, .json, .jpeg, and .png extensions.


For example:



/2010-04-01/Accounts/AC.../Message/MM.../Media/ME557ce644e5ab84fa21cc21112e22c485



Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.


Warmest Regards,

Dear ____,
Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. Great question! This is a two step process. You will need to first use the Media List Resource to retrieve a list of media SIDs associated with your message.
https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/rest/media#list
Then, you can use the Media Instance Resource to retrieve the individual image file associated with a message by using the individual media SIDs.
https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/rest/media#instance
Please take a look at the "Default: Content-Type Section". Please end the resource with just the Media SID without .xml, .json, .jpeg, and .png extensions.
For example:
/2010-04-01/Accounts/AC.../Message/MM.../Media/ME557ce644e5ab84fa21cc21112e22c485

!ApiMMSConverter

Dear _____,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support.


Great question. Please note that Twilio only has MMS capable numbers within US and Canada. Twilio numbers for other international countries only support SMS messaging. If you will like to send MMS messages to international countries (where when MMS converter is enabled will convert the message to SMS with a shortened URL linking to the image), please use our MMS capable numbers from US and Canada.


https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223181608-Can-I-send-or-receive-MMS-messages-


Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.


Warmest Regards,

!ApiMaxPrice

GENERAL INFO ABOUT MAX PRICE:


Dear _____,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. Great question!


May you please clarify are you trying to set the "maximum price" for the amount of messages that can be sent? And once the "maximum price" is met, messages will not be sent that will exceed the maximum price that is met? If this is what you are looking for, Twilio offers a "MaxPrice" parameter that you can use. For more information, please see:


https://www.twilio.com/blog/2015/08/introducing-max-price.html 


Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help. 


Warmest Regards,




———


USING MAX PRICE TO LIMIT MESSAGE SEGMENTS:


If their main concern is about message segments, they can take advantage of the "MaxPrice" feature. Suppose they are only sending US messages and they don't want message with multiple segments to go out. They can then set the MaxPrice parameter to 0.0075. This way if one of their message happen to include a unicode character and the message has to be sent with multiple segments, our API will stop it and throw a 400 response
API - Send SMS - MaxPrice

GENERAL INFO ABOUT MAX PRICE:
Dear _____,
Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. Great question!
May you please clarify are you trying to set the "maximum price" for the amount of messages that can be sent? And once the "maximum price" is met, messages will not be sent that will exceed the maximum price that is met? If this is what you are looking for, Twilio offers a "MaxPrice" parameter that you can use. For more information, please see:
https://www.twilio.com/blog/2015/08/introducing-max-price.html
Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.
Warmest Regards,
———
USING MAX PRICE TO LIMIT MESSAGE SEGMENTS:
If their main concern is about message segments, they can take advantage of the "MaxPrice" feature. Suppose they are only sending US messages and they don't want message with multiple segments to go out. They can then set the MaxPrice parameter to 0.0075. This way if one of their message happen to include a unicode character and the message has to be sent with multiple segments, our API will stop it and throw a 400 response

!ApiSameNumber

Dear ______,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I am very sorry to hear you are unable to deliver messages to and from your Twilio number.


Our Messaging Team made changes as of 8/10/17. As of 8/10/2017 customers are no longer able to send messages TO/FROM the same number. This has been put in place to prevent customers from message looping and causing them to drain their funds. It's important to note that customers can still however send to other Twilio numbers.


I apologize for the inconvenience. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.


Warmest Regards,

Our Messaging Team made changes as of 8/10/17. As of 8/10/2017 customers are no longer able to send messages TO/FROM the same number. This has been put in place to prevent customers from message looping and causing them to drain their funds. It's important to note that customers can still however send to other Twilio numbers.
I apologize for the inconvenience. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.

!ApiCustomParam

ADD CUSTOM PARAMETERS TO MSG REQUEST URL / STATUS CALLBACK URL:


Dear _____,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. Great question!


We do not support adding customer parameters. As workaround, please add the additional parameters into the Message Request URL, hence when your end users respond, we will call back to that URL with the same ID included.


For example, let's say this was your Message Request URL: https://www.twilio.com/id=103, as long as you append the unique parameter in your Request URL, we will make a callback to the URL with the parameter appended. You can track it this way based on what is appended in the Message Request URL.


Unfortunately, aside from this method, there is no other way for Twilio to add custom parameters.


Please let me know if you have further questions.


Thanks,


_________


Dear _______,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. Great question!


It is possible to indicate a unique ID within the Statuscallback URLs. When Twilio makes a call back to your Callback URL, we will include the same unique ID provided in the URL. May you please kindly test and let me know your findings.


Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.


Warmest Regards,

!ApiUniqueID

Dear _____,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. Great question!


There isn't a way to pass data/use unique identifier to an outgoing SMS to keep track of conversations.Twilio only tracks conversations between two numbers through cookies (please see below for more information on how to use cookies), but we are unable to track which responses are for which topic of conversation. We will just track everything as one conversation as how it is like sending messages from a handset-to-handset. 


What you can do to differentiate conversations is to maintain the session store yourself, e.g. with a database table of "From", "To", and timestamp. Twilio cookies are keyed off of "From" and "To", so you can implement the same kind of conversation tracking yourself by storing data this way. If you would like to differentiate conversations by To/From and specific topics, you may have to track other unique metadata to differentiate the conversations. For example, you and your end users can input a unique identifier in the message or some sort of unique keyword that can help differentiate the conversations.


To learn more about how to use cookies to track SMS conversations:


https://www.twilio.com/docs/quickstart/ruby/sms/tracking-conversations 


https://www.twilio.com/blog/2014/07/the-definitive-guide-to-sms-conversation-tracking.html 


https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223136287-How-do-Twilio-cookies-work- 


Please let me know if you have further questions.



Thanks,
API - SMS Conversations - Cannot Add Unique Identifier to Track Topic Convos

Dear _____,
Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. Great question!
There isn't a way to pass data/use unique identifier to an outgoing SMS to keep track of conversations.Twilio only tracks conversations between two numbers through cookies (please see below for more information on how to use cookies), but we are unable to track which responses are for which topic of conversation. We will just track everything as one conversation as how it is like sending messages from a handset-to-handset.
What you can do to differentiate conversations is to maintain the session store yourself, e.g. with a database table of "From", "To", and timestamp. Twilio cookies are keyed off of "From" and "To", so you can implement the same kind of conversation tracking yourself by storing data this way. If you would like to differentiate conversations by To/From and specific topics, you may have to track other unique metadata to differentiate the conversations. For example, you and your end users can input a unique identifier in the message or some sort of unique keyword that can help differentiate the conversations.
To learn more about how to use cookies to track SMS conversations:
https://www.twilio.com/docs/quickstart/ruby/sms/tracking-conversations
https://www.twilio.com/blog/2014/07/the-definitive-guide-to-sms-conversation-tracking.html
https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223136287-How-do-Twilio-cookies-work-
Please let me know if you have further questions.
Thanks,
!ApiLineBreaks

Dear ____,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I am very sorry to hear you are unable to add new lines when sending SMS messages. 


In most programming languages the \n (newline) character will work, however not all mobile carriers will be able to render this line break. Some may just show it as a white space. 


For more information regarding how to use line breaks, please review the below documentation:


https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223181468-How-do-I-Add-a-Line-Break-in-my-SMS-or-MMS-Message- 


Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.


Warmest Regards,

!ApiSMSDelay

Dear _____,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. Great question(s)!


Please note that Twilio does not directly support the ability to delay SMS messages being sent out or set a specific time in which you will like the messages to be sent out. This is not supported through Twilio's platform and through our Add-ons. However, through additional programming, you can add this logic within your application or can configure this setting on your server's side. 

Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.

Warmest Regards,

Josephine T.
Technical Support Engineer
Twilio, Inc
